comments.body: Spiral M-PoolsFollowing my death, my younger brother published the MMM mathematical algorithm. The algorithm introduces a unique method of creating liquidity pools, each one being a stable MMM system, independent of time and panic.I call them - spiral M-pools. Each spiral M-pool splits all the participants staking within it into two teams. Each team partakes in a financial battle where there are always winners (who receive profit) and losers (who fund it). In other words, it's a financial game solely governed by the participants' behavior.As you can see, under such a definition, the spiral M-pool algorithm doesn't differ from the stock trading process, where there's also a financial game and competition, correct? However, the MMM algorithm precisely predicts the conditions for participants to earn profit, and reaching these conditions depends only on team actions, not on an external uncertain force.Vanga predicted: "A pyramid from Russia will spread across the world." After my death, many might have thought this prediction would never come true. Yet, perhaps, everything is just beginning.Link to my brother's post: https://www.facebook.com/MavrodiVP/posts/pfbid02nvvpudKy1dh9stBRAtiN4Z8ENzBrqHrpC7q7cAknh7z9wcfFPP7mQwZ4gXjMdAuclLink for quick algorithm download: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XtOrw7natYmMMK-CZ4qFZ0-KNxc_IikA/view?fbclid=IwAR3NzH4IJne0L7v5vVAfSvqo7BzXIrOy6GLuUzuEOv4Q_CSHcoaaLztOq9A

comments.body: Money from Thin AirToday, I want to explain the MMM algorithm to you in a simple manner. Imagine two comrades â€“ Alexey (A) and Vasiliy (V). And I have in my hands 2 sets of 100 pieces of old calendars.Day 1 (Pool 1)Buy/Sell rates (in USD): 100/100I address Alexey: "Alexey, buy this set of calendars from me today for 100 USD, and tomorrow I'll buy it back from you for 110 USD, i.e., 10% more expensive." Alexey agrees.Result of the first day: I have 100 USD, but tomorrow I owe Alexey 110 USD. How to solve this problem? Very simple: I invite Vasiliy.Day 2 (Pool 2)Buy/Sell rates (in USD): 120/110Vasiliy comes, and I make him the same offer, but with different prices. I set today's buying rate for Vasiliy higher than the old selling rate for Alexey. This way, with Vasiliy's money, I can pay off Alexey and still make a profit.Vasiliy buys a set of calendars from me for 120 USD, and I promise to buy them back tomorrow for 132 USD. Meanwhile, in my wallet is 220 USD. I pay Alexey the promised 110 USD, and I'm left with 110 USD. But tomorrow, I owe Vasiliy 132 USD. What to do?Day 3 (Pool 3)Buy/Sell rates (in USD): 145/132Alexey returns and says he wants to buy the calendars again and get 10%. I sell them to him for 145 USD, promising to buy them back tomorrow for 159 USD. Using this money, I pay off Vasiliy.Day 4 (Pool 4)Buy/Sell rates (in USD): 175/159Now Vasiliy wants to buy the calendars again. And the cycle continues. You get the idea... I hope :-))________________If Vasiliy doesn't have enough money to buy the entire set of calendars, I offer him to buy as many calendars from the set as he wants. Each calendar then turns into a fully real trading instrument with planned yield.And now, to avoid the obligation to sell all participants' calendars, I declare that they sell calendars to each other, but at rates that I set. And from now on, in this system, there is no time as a criterion for yield (no % per month!). There is only the volume of sales that all participants need to make in order to get income according to the plan.This algorithm, in essence, is a way of redistributing free money among the participants of some System. As you've noticed, such a System starts without any initial investments. During its operation, all participants alternately make a profit. And it's not necessarily to have a large number of participants, like in "pyramids".The System can be started with ANY number of people more than one: in a family; a working collective; a country; the world. The System can be considered established as soon as the 2nd package is sold. After that, it operates as long as there are people willing to get the established system percentages of profit; or until there is no FREE money left in the family; collective; country; on planet Earth. ðŸ˜‰Therefore, MMM is a financial business machine, the product of which is money from thin air for everyone.Respectfully,Your electronic,Artificially-eternalSergey Panteleevich Mavrodi
